items.title: Hastie and Taylor fail to agree on plan to oust Ley despite clandestine meeting
items.description: The two conservative men vying to replace Sussan Ley as leader of the Liberal Party met in Melbourne before attending a memorial service for their former colleague Katie Allen.

items.title: Howard's cheat sheet could prove handy for the Coalition
items.description: Former prime minister John Howard once observed that Pauline Hanson was an "electoral gift to the Labor Party". His words proved relevant this week as the Coalition's chaos dragged on.

items.title: CCTV shows triple murder suspect at police station on day of shooting
items.description: The NSW Police commissioner says a surge in domestic violence attacks is a disgrace as police release footage of Julian Ingram, the main suspect wanted over the deadly Lake Cargelligo shooting.

items.title: 'Mayhem' as fast-moving bushfire engulfs backyards in suburban Perth
items.description: Between six and eight homes were damaged by a fast-moving bushfire in suburban Perth, the Department of Fire and Emergency Services says, with residents who fled the area told to stay away until it is safe to return.

items.title: Shots fired, traffic chaos as allegedly stolen car crashes into school bus
items.description: Two arrests have been made after police shot at an allegedly stolen car that collided with a school bus before driving towards officers in Geelong.

items.title: Line search of river planned for area where Celine Cremer went missing
items.description: Police say forensic testing will be done to determine the identity of the remains, as officers prepare for a further search along a section of the Arthur River.

items.title: Live: Sabalenka roars past Svitolina into fourth straight Australian Open final
items.description: Elena Rybakina and Jessica Pegula face off for the right to meet Aryna Sabalenka in her fourth straight Australian Open final after the world number one beat Elina Svitolina in straight sets in their semifinal. Follow live.

items.title: 'Never seen magnitude' of foreign vessels in Far North Queensland, locals say
items.description: Torres Strait Island leaders say federal government claims of strong border protections do not match what communities are seeing on their doorstep in Queensland's far north.

items.title: Trump has mostly held his plans for Venezuela close to his chest — until now
items.description: Until this week, the Trump administration had provided few details about how involved it would be in Venezuela's governance. New information suggests it will look to hold the purse strings for some time.

items.title: Which US forces have been sent to the Middle East, and what does their arrival mean?
items.description: A US aircraft carrier, supporting warships, fighter jets and air-defence systems have arrived in the Middle East, as the world waits to see to what action — if any — Donald Trump will take against Iran.

items.title: K'gari backpacker's family to travel to Australia
items.description: The heartbroken parents of Canadian backpacker Piper James will travel to Australia next week to visit K'gari, the island where their beloved daughter lost her life.

items.title: Why it took nearly 30 minutes for police to evacuate Perth Invasion Day rally
items.description: As police face criticism for their handling of Perth's Invasion Day rally bomb scare, a law enforcement expert says they faced a "no-win situation".

items.title: 'Terrible idea': Backlash over plan for extra public holiday on NSW
items.description: New South Wales residents could get an extra public holiday in April with Anzac Day falling on a weekend in 2026 and 2027.

items.title: Bluey tops US streaming charts for second year running
items.description: Americans tuned in to watch 45.2 billion minutes of Bluey, Bingo, Bandit and Chilli last year.

items.title: How to prepare for breastfeeding before your baby arrives
items.description: While most mothers in Australia start breastfeeding, by the time babies are five months old, exclusive breastfeeding drops to 15 per cent. Knowing what to expect — before bub is born — can increase the chances of meeting your breastfeeding goals.

items.title: How our interactions with AI mirror and reinforce real-world misogyny
items.description: The design choices behind AI technologies — female voices, deferential responses, playful deflections — create a permissive environment for gendered aggression.

items.title: Quiz: How well did you survive six weeks with the kids at home?
items.description: We made it. The kids are returning to school. See how much you learned during the most recent, interminable school holiday period with our quiz.

items.title: Tiny-home community set to offer solution to affordable housing
items.description: A permanent community of tiny homes in WA's South West has been given planning approval. The proposal, pitched as a unique solution to the housing crisis, has drawn criticism from neighbours.

items.title: UN expert seeks to join challenge to NSW government's protest restrictions
items.description: A United Nations expert is seeking to join a constitutional challenge to the NSW government's protest restrictions brought in after the Bondi terrorist attack.

items.title: China executes online scam ringleaders from Myanmar
items.description: China executes 11 people linked to Myanmar criminal gangs, including "key members" involved in online scam operations.

items.title: Father handed life sentence for setting wife on fire in front of kids
items.description: A Victorian Supreme Court judge sentences Roland James Griffiths to 32 years in prison without parole for the "brutal" murder of wife, 35-year-old Kylie Sheahan.

items.title: How to see more ABC News stories in Google Search
items.description: Google now lets you choose which publisher you want to see more of in your search results. Here's a step-by-step guide to ensuring the latest ABC News stories appear at the top of your feed.

items.title: A deadly virus has been re-detected in India. Asian countries are taking no chances
items.description: Two cases of the Nipah virus have been detected in India, prompting a raft of screening measures to be enacted in countries across Asia.

items.title: UK wants 'sophisticated relationship' with China, Starmer tells Xi
items.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer tells Chinese President Xi Jinping he wants to build a "sophisticated relationship" aiming to boost growth and security, signalling a breakthrough in ties after years of acrimony.

items.title: Grape sunscreen and chicken sprinklers help farmers beat the heat
items.description: How farmers make sure their livestock — and produce — stay safe during a heatwave.
